articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military prepared for ground operations in Gaza to root out the Hamas militant group, whose deadly rampage through Israeli border towns last week stunned the nation.
articles.title: Israel and Hamas at war: Latest news

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu sheltered in a bunker for five minutes on Monday when air raid sirens went off in Tel Aviv during their meeting, State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said.
articles.title: Blinken, Netanyahu shelter in bunker amid air raid sirens in Tel Aviv

articles.author: Daniel Trotta
articles.description: An Illinois man was charged with hate crimes for stabbing a 6-year-old Muslim boy to death and wounding his mother in an attack that targeted them for their religion and as a response to the war between Israel and Hamas, officials and Muslim rights activists said on Sunday.
articles.title: Illinois man charged with hate crime in fatal stabbing of Muslim boy

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: As Israeli air strikes pounded the Gaza Strip ahead of an expected ground offensive, the enclave's residents were getting more desperate by the hour as water runs out, garbage piles up, explosions flatten homes and hospitals struggle to cope.
articles.title: In Gaza, people resort to drinking salty water, garbage piles up

articles.author: Joseph Campbell
articles.description: Being unsafe in her own home was a feeling that 87-year-old Holocaust survivor Ruth Haran had not experienced since the end of World War Two.
articles.title: Holocaust survivor escapes Hamas but fears for missing family

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations Security Council was due to vote on Monday on rival draft resolutions on Israel and Gaza that focus largely on the humanitarian situation, but it was unclear whether either stood a chance of being adopted.
articles.title: UN to vote on rival resolutions on Israel and Gaza

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: Scotland's leader Humza Yousaf said his wife's parents were fast running out of food and drinking water in Gaza and could die if unable to leave soon.
articles.title: Scottish leader says wife's parents risk running out of food in Gaza

articles.author: Yusri Mohamed, Nadine Awadalla, Tala Ramadan
articles.description: Egypt said on Monday that Israel was not cooperating with delivery of aid into Gaza and evacuations of foreign passport holders via the only entry it does not wholly control, leaving hundreds of tonnes of supplies stuck.
articles.title: Gaza aid stuck as Egypt says Israel not cooperating

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden's White House is wrestling with a host of thorny security and political challenges as officials plot a potential trip to Israel that may hold longer-term diplomatic advantages for Biden.
articles.title: Potential Biden trip to Israel rife with security, political challenges

articles.author: Ted Hesson
articles.description: The U.S. will offer migrant families separated at the U.S.-Mexico border under then-President Donald Trump temporary legal status and other benefits while barring similar separations in the future, according to a settlement agreement filed on Monday.
articles.title: US offers legal status, benefits to migrant families separated under Trump
